did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Lawrence family papers (series 34)

bioghist.p: The Lawrence family is allied to the Smith family through the marriage of Mary Lewis (1808-1892)and George Smith (1804-1882). Mary Lewis was the daughter of Abraham Lewis and Rebecca Lawrence (1766-1829). Rebecca Lawrence was the daughter of Henry Lawrence (1721-1802) and Hannah Massey (1732-1791). Her brothers were Henry (1763-1810) and Clement (1768-1844), merchants.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Lawrence family papers. Materials include: Henry and Clement Lawrence day books, wool account books, and sales of wool; receipt book; an account book of Clement Lawrence (1807-1821); Lawrence land survey printed in 1924; Clement Lawrence Smith's Haverford College notebooks; and correspondence, clippings, newsletters, and blueprints regarding the restoration of the Lawrence Cabin in Haverford Township. Other items in the collection documenting the Lawrence family include: stock certificates of the Philadelphia Savings Institution; genealogy notes of Eleanor Houston Smith; correspondence regarding Isaac Lawrence's burial; "Memorandum made by Clement Lawrence of the time and decease of his relations and some other of his acquaintances (1748-1839); notes regarding the land of Thomas Ellis, father-in-law of David Lawrence, 1684 (1761); Obituary of Henry Lawrence (1810); will of Eleanor Lawrence (1724); "An account of our age given by mother" written by Henry and Ellin Lawrence (1714-1733); land lease agreement (1726); deed, receipt, and will of Mordecai Lawrence; Clement Lawrence's math copybook (1782); and Ann Morris's Cyphering Book (1792; later used as an account book).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
